formattedAddress: 3 E 43rd St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 3 E 43rd St, New York, NY 10017-4604, USA

originalText.text: Accounting hopefuls don’t waste your time! You’ll only receive BBA while they tell you there’s no Bachelor of Accounting Degree after the fact! Don’t trust your advisors like I did! They’ll tell you anything to get you to sign up & then google the degree you’re supposed to have when you question them! Horrible experience with the run around for answers & then hang up on you! Don’t bother, choose a school that cares!

originalText.text: THIEVES!!! WORST SO CALLED COLLEGE EVER!!! THEY TAKE ADVANTAGE OF LOW INCOME STUDENTS.THEY TAKE ALL YOUR PELL & TAP. BE AWARE!!! THEY MAKE YOU OR YOUR PARENTS SIGN PAPERS TO TAKE OUT SCHOOL LOANS. THEN RUIN PEOPLES CREDIT. DON'T GO HERE STAY AWAY. GO TO A CUNY OR SUNY SCHOOL BETTER. THEY ARE REAL COLLEGES. THIS IS A FAKE SCHOOL.

originalText.text: Berkeley College was a wonderful experience for me, even though it is a very expensive school. But they made me feel like I was home, very good professors, I enjoyed all my classes, and my professors. I recently graduated with my associates degree and it was a wonderful experience. I would totally recommend this school. Wish I had the nerve to take out more loans but I've had enough with the loans I have. Thank you Berkeley College for making me feel like I was home, and doing everything possible for me to graduate. I truly appreciate it.

originalText.text:
The best college ever! The best opportunity in your life! Berkeley College is a small college but very professional one. You can find everything you want there, an excellent stuff who works hard and is always waiting for you, a sophisticated technology, using up different sources to make you succeed, a big stuff helping out students to finds jobs and internships, They will do everything to motivate you and prepare you for your future success. That's the way I see this college. It may be a little bit expansive but when it's about our future we have to invest first. Everything in this college is great. Let me start sharing me experience with you:

I come from a small country from Europe, where we have a completely different system than here that seems to be a completely stress-free. My English level was not so good, and I still find it difficulty sometimes, but it was not a obstetrical for me at all, because all the professors helped me. And I am definitely glad for all the professors that I had, for 19 of them (5 quarters until now), they are all gorgeous. They never stop telling their student to use them as much as possible. They are respectful, patient, helpful, easy to understand, and they will try everything and every method for the student to succeed, after that is up to the students. If you do what the professors tell you to do you'll be fine, and that's what I and all my friends do. And we enjoy time in the class, we work in group, we discuss and bring new topics in class related with the lectures. And what is the beauty of Berkeley College is the diversity that it has. I consider myself lucky to have peers form different part of the world, because in an easy way help me to learn more about what's going around and try to understand other cultures too, thing that is very important if you live in a city as New York.

I agree with a review here that in short terms tells that Berkeley College is a easy college to enter in because it accept everyone. That's true! But that's what make this college a successful college, because it gives everyone an opportunity. Just because you didn't do well doesn't mean that your life should end there, no college any more no career, nothing. No! That's why Berkeley College has hired good professors, where mostly of them has a PhD degree. And if that is not enough Berkeley College offers Academic Support Center tutoring to make our life easier.

Another great thing that I like at Berkeley College is that the stuff and the professors will define you by your name, not by your ID number, which makes me feel very good and think that people who work here care for me. And I am never lost in the class, like in the big colleges. If I would need help I will go there and ask and these people will always always be ready to help me out.

originalText.text:
I had the worse college applying experience. This is for the Paramus NJ Campus. I was a prospective student. Unfortunately, I’m on temporary disability for now so I figured “why not go back to school to pursue my dreams?!”. Well, Berkeley admissions gave me a HORRIBLE experience. They stopped following up with me unlike other universities I applied to. No one knew what was going on in my admissions process. I gave this college money that THEY knew I didn’t have because of my disability because I wanted to attend. All of that for these fools to tell me they’re only accepting a portion of the credits I took for my associates degree. I am going to attend a prestigious university that knows what they’re doing and how to handle their prospective students. Putting effort into this college was WORTHLESS!!!

Now a month later after my horrible experience the director of admissions Janine contacts me to stand up for her poor excuse of a staffs behavior. She called to say “sorry”. What kind of BS is that?! I don’t need a sorry, I need not to receive a phone call from your sorry college ever again!!
